page.title: 20LOOKING AT YEOFORD'S FUTURE.
page.content: This area is, at the moment, a very peaceful place with lovely views. It is mainly concerned with agriculture since the closing, a few years ago, of the sawmills. It has the one shop, the school, a railway station, a telephone kiosk and three pillar boxes. There are, however three building sites. This could mean over seventy extra houses. How will the area cope with the extra people? Will the school have enough room? What will the children do in their spare time? How will the lanes cope with the extra traffic? Yeoford is at a time of change. We hope it will not spoil the area. The children of Yeoford School have thoroughly enjoyed working on the Domesday Project. Twenty seven children took part. The youngest was eight and the eldest was eleven. Most of the children live in the area.
